subject: [cs-opportunities] Upcoming Events @ NYU MakerSpace Design Lab
body_text:
*Intro to Three.js
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__luma.com_u6mzdf8e&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=80cd5DVpUcN3Ok07Ocnexg&m=FikpGdD3yzd5vZzmCk-TitzNjh5uErzktGy--KekvT4okQcCNN5m9kv5-yh44Xtk&s=FZjC2tn6Li3-kvlMn5Noab0cDY46XwHJSbNQPH2g1Z4&e=>*

Monday, Dec 1st | 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM | MakerSpace Design Lab, 6 Metrotech

This event is open to the NYU Community (active students, staff, and
faculty).

This workshop will demonstrate how to build a landing page with 3D elements
and scroll interactions. The website will be bundled using Vite, stored in
a Git repository and deployed on Netlify.


*NYU Prototyping Fund Showcase
<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3A__luma.com_0abpqmac&d=DwMFaQ&c=slrrB7dE8n7gBJbeO0g-IQ&r=80cd5DVpUcN3Ok07Ocnexg&m=FikpGdD3yzd5vZzmCk-TitzNjh5uErzktGy--KekvT4okQcCNN5m9kv5-yh44Xtk&s=aVhK4dq3d5Aq7QEH7O1MjGFHYhrGDZewEkwd6LflU4g&e=>*

Friday, Dec 5th | 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM | MakerSpace Design Lab, 6 Metrotech

This event is open to the NYU Community (active students, staff, and
faculty).

The NYU Prototyping Fund awards teams of students up to $500 in the first
round of funding and up to $2,000 in the second to be used to build
prototypes, and connects them to resources to bring their ideas to life!
Join us as they present their projects and discuss their findings!
body_html:
Intro to Three.js

Monday, Dec 1st | 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM | MakerSpace Design Lab, 6 Metrotech

This event is open to the NYU Community (active students, staff, and faculty). 

This workshop will demonstrate how to build a landing page with 3D elements and scroll interactions. The website will be bundled using Vite, stored in a Git repository and deployed on Netlify.


NYU Prototyping Fund Showcase

Friday, Dec 5th | 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM | MakerSpace Design Lab, 6 Metrotech

This event is open to the NYU Community (active students, staff, and faculty). 

The NYU Prototyping Fund awards teams of students up to $500 in the first round of funding and up to $2,000 in the second to be used to build prototypes, and connects them to resources to bring their ideas to life! Join us as they present their projects and discuss their findings!
